str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
Much, many; often.
From asitos; fasting.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From a compound of peitho and archo; to be persuaded by a ruler, i.e. to submit to authority; by analogy, to conform to advice.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Crete. Of uncertain derivation; Crete, an island in the Mediterranean.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
To gain, acquire, win (over), avoid loss. From kerdos; to gain.
This; he, she, it.
(a) insult, injury, outrage, (b) damage, loss. From huper; insolence, i.e. Insult, injury.
And, even, also, namely.
Damage, loss, detriment. Probably akin to the base of damazo; detriment.
